dcterms:creator: G. Ditzler
R. Polikar
dcterms:description: This dataset describes one-step-ahead prediction whether or not rain occurs. It records the weather data over 50 years containing the yearly seasonal change as well as the long-term climate change.
dcterms:title: Weather

dcterms:creator: W. N. Street
Y.-S. Kim
dcterms:description: This problem is a synthetic dataset having both recurring and abrupt concept drift. The binary classification satisfies f1 + f2 ≥ θ, where θ changes three times as θ = 4 → 7 → 4 → 7, which causes concept drift.
dcterms:title: Sea

dcterms:creator: A. Bifet
R. Gavaldà
dcterms:description: This problem is designed to predict the position of d − th dimensional hyperplane satisfying the condition that the sum of weighted features exceeds a threshold. The transition period when the second distribution replaces the first one causes the gradual drift in this dataset.
dcterms:title: Hyperplane

dcterms:creator: S. J. Stolfo
W. Fan
W. Lee
A. Prodromidis
P. K. Chan
dcterms:description: This dataset describes a network intrusion detection problem where the simulation of various network attacks results in the non-stationary characteristic.
dcterms:title: KDDCup

dcterms:creator: P. Baldi
P. D. Sadowski
D. Whiteson
dcterms:description: This dataset contains 5 million instances, which presents a signal process causing super-symmetric particles. Although it is stationary, this dataset has a big characteristic thereby being able to test the algorithm’s characteristic in overcoming a large-scale problem.
dcterms:title: SUSY

dcterms:creator: M. Masud
J. Gao
L. Khan
J. Han
B. M. Thuraisingham
dcterms:description: This dataset describes the separation of particle-producing collisions from a background with a big size that contains more than 10 million samples. As with the SUSY dataset, this dataset is deployed to examine the algorithm’s performance in the large-scale setting.
dcterms:title: Hepmass

dcterms:creator: A. Geiger
P. Lenz
R. Urtasun
dcterms:description: This dataset constitutes a real-world computer vision problem derived from the autonomous driving problem in the city of Kalsruhe, Germany. The underlying goal is to perform 3D object detection where the object is captured by two high-resolution color and grayscale video cameras.
dcterms:title: Kitti

dcterms:creator: A. Ashfahani
M. Pratama
E. Lughofer
E. Y. K. Yee
dcterms:description: This problem features a quality detection problem of a transparent part of a scent-emitting USB device manufactured by an injection-molding machine. There are two common defects of the transparent part: short-forming and weaving rendering it a three-class classification problem.
dcterms:title: Online Quality Classification (OQC)
